sentence: what you need to know to start your day get new york today in your inbox the stories of narcoviolence piled up high on monday as jurors at the trial of joaqun guzmn loera heard gruesome testimony about six separate brutal drug war murders
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: one of the victims nearly had his head cut off by a fusillade of gunfire
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: another was killed on his doorstep after being lured from home when he was told falsely that his son had just been run down by a car
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: a third made a small but fatal error he refused one day to shake mr guzmns hand
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: last week the federal prosecutors trying mr guzmn the mexican drug kingpin known as el chapo offered evidence about the gothic bloodshed his cartel routinely committed
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: but as the proceeding entered its second week the government began to tie that violence directly to mr guzmn
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: instead of these gory tales the courtroom audience had expected a prosecution witness jesus zambada garca to confess to a bombshell act of corruption
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: last week in a private sidebar conversation mr guzmns lawyers said that mr zambada would testify to having paid at least 6 million to the incumbent president of mexico that testimony never came on monday but it may on tuesday when mr zambada returns to the stand
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: but no less than a halfdozen times on monday mr zambada said that mr guzmn his former boss in the sinaloa drug cartel had arranged for people to be killed for seemingly minor reasons
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: in what was mr zambadas third day as a witness mr guzmn emerged as a kind of gunloving hothead who owned a diamondencrusted pistol with his initials on the handle and who once relaxed by taking target practice with a bazooka
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: from the start of the trial which is being held in federal district court in brooklyn prosecutors have accused mr guzmn not only of earning 14 billion by routinely shipping tonsize batches of drugs into the united states but also of taking part in more than 30 murders
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: mr zambada began on monday to describe some of those killings starting with the slaying of rodolfo carrillo fuentes a former member of the sinaloa cartel
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: in 2004 he said mr guzmn and mr carrillo fuentes were rivals as part of a larger war between the sinaloa traffickers and a vicious gang the zetas with whom mr carrillo fuentes had allied himself
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: at a meeting to restore the peace mr guzmns longtime partner ismael zambada garca tried to broker a truce
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: but when mr guzmn put his hand out mr carrillo fuentes did not take it
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: not long after mr zambada said armed assassins lay in wait for mr carrillo fuentes and his unsuspecting wife gunning both down as they exited a movie theater in culiacn
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: chapo said he was going to kill him mr zambada told the jury
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: the next year a similar fate befell julio beltranleyva another one of mr guzmns former allies
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: according to mr zambada mr beltranleyva had disobeyed an order not to send a shipment of cocaine from acapulco
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: at mr guzmns behest mr zambada testified a team of assassins attacked mr beltranleyva firing so many rifle rounds at him that his head was left dangling from his neck
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: it was clear from mondays testimony that drug trafficking especially in mr guzmns orbit was not an occupation that promoted health or longevity
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: people around him seemed to die with alarming frequency
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: there was for instance his younger brother arturito guzmn who was murdered in prison on new years eve in 2004
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: there was also a police officer who usually stayed at home out of fear but walked outside into a spray of bullets after one of mr guzmns killers knocked on his door and shouted a lie that his child had just been hit by a car
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: even those who endured the violence surrounding mr guzmn required a level of machismo to survive
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: one gunman caught in the crossfire of mr beltranleyvas murder was knocked unconscious for five or 10 minutes with a head wound mr zambada said
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: when he finally awoke the gunman dismissed the wound as a scratch william purpura one of mr guzmns lawyers asked mr zambada a few questions on monday afternoon largely pointing out that in prior statements he had never mentioned mr guzmn in connection with some of the murders the government accused him of committing
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: mr purpura also suggested that mr zambada was a liar who could say whatever he wanted since most of the people who could corroborate  or refute  his account were already dead
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: mr purpura noted that juan jos esparragoza mr guzmns mentor who knew him better than anyone was dead  and so was mr guzmns brother arturito
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: mr guzmans former ally amado carrillo fuentes  a brother of rodolfo  was also deceased mr purpura said having bled to death in 1997 while undergoing plastic surgery
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: all of them are dead mr purpura told the witness
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: so theres really no one but you correct mr zambada readily agreed
author: Alan Feuer
title: El Chapo Witness Details Brutal Drug War Murders

sentence: fortunately he said im alive

sentence: the stone philosophers have been talking about skepticism for a long time
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: some of those insights can shed light on our public discourse regarding climate change
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: dr pinillos is a professor of philosophy at arizona state university
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: no matter how smart or educated you are what you dont know far surpasses anything you may know
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: socrates taught us the virtue of recognizing our limitations
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: wisdom he said requires possessing a type of humility manifested in an awareness of ones own ignorance
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: since then the value of being aware of our ignorance has been a recurring theme in western thought ren descartes said its necessary to doubt all things to build a solid foundation for science and ludwig wittgenstein reflecting on the limits of language said that the difficulty in philosophy is to say no more than we know awareness of ignorance appears to be common in politics as well
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: in a recent 60 minutes interview president trump said of global warming i dont know that its manmade the same sentiment was echoed by larry kudlow the director of the national economic council
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: perhaps trump and kudlow confident in their ignorance on these important issues are simply expressing philosophical humility and wisdom
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: or perhaps not
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: sometimes when it appears that someone is expressing doubt what he is really doing is recommending a course of action
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: for example if i tell you that i dont know whether there is milk in the fridge im not exhibiting philosophical wisdom  im simply recommending that you check the fridge before you go shopping
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: from this perspective what trump is doing is telling us that governmental decisions should not assume that global warming is caused by humans
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: according to nasa at least 97 percent of actively publishing climate scientists think that climatewarming trends over the past century are extremely likely caused by human activities americans overwhelmingly agree that the federal government needs to take significant action
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: in a recent poll conducted by stanford university abc news and resources for the future 61 percent of those surveyed said that the federal government should take a great deal or a lot of action to curb global warming
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: and an additional 19 percent believe that the government should take moderate action
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: as a philosopher i have nothing to add to the scientific evidence of global warming but i can tell you how its possible to get ourselves to sincerely doubt things despite abundant evidence to the contrary
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: i also have suggestions about how to fix this
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: to understand how its possible to doubt something despite evidence to the contrary try some thought experiments
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: suppose you observe a shopper at the convenience store buying a lottery ticket
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: you are aware that the probability that he will lose the lottery is astronomically high typically above 9999 percent but its hard to get yourself to sincerely say you know this person will lose the lottery
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: now imagine your doctor screens you for a disease and the test comes out negative
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: but consider the possibility that this result is one of those rare false negative cases
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: do you really know the result of this particular test is not a false negative
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: these scenarios suggest that its possible to feel as though you dont know something even when possessing enormous evidence in its favor
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: philosophers call scenarios like these skeptical pressure cases and they arise in mundane boring cases that have nothing to do with politics or what one wants to be true
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: in general a skeptical pressure case is a thought experiment in which the protagonist has good evidence for something that he or she believes but the reader is reminded that the protagonist could have made a mistake
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: if the story is set up in the right way the reader will be tempted to think that the protagonists belief isnt genuine knowledge
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: when presented with these thought experiments some philosophy students conclude that what these examples show is that knowledge requires fullblown certainty
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: in these skeptical pressure cases the evidence is overwhelming but not 100 percent
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: its an attractive idea but it doesnt sit well with the fact that we ordinarily say we know lots of things with much lower probability
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: for example i know i will be grading student papers this weekend
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: although the chance of this happening is high it is not anything close to 100 percent since there is always the chance ill get sick or that something more important will come up
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: in fact the chance of getting sick and not grading is much higher than the chance of winning the lottery
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: so how could it be that i know i will be grading and not know that the shopper at the convenience store will lose the lottery
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: philosophers have been studying skeptical pressure intensely for the past 50 years
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: although there is no consensus about how it arises a promising idea defended by the philosopher david lewis is that skeptical pressure cases often involve focusing on the possibility of error
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: once we start worrying and ruminating about this possibility no matter how farfetched something in our brains causes us to doubt
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: the philosopher jennifer nagel aptly calls this type of effect epistemic anxiety in my own work i have speculated that an extreme version of this phenomenon is operative in obsessive compulsive disorder a condition that affects millions of americans
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: in many cases of ocd patients are paralyzed with doubt about some fact  against all evidence
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: for example a patient might doubt whether she turned off her stove despite having just checked multiple times
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: as with skeptical pressure cases the focus on the possibility that one might be wrong plays a central role in the phenomenon
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: lets return to climate change skepticism
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: according to social psychology climate change deniers tend to espouse conservative views which suggests that party ideology is partly responsible for these attitudes
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: i think that we should also think about the philosophical nature of skeptical reactions an apolitical phenomenon
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: the standard response by climate skeptics is a lot like our reaction to skeptical pressure cases
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: climate skeptics understand that 97 percent of scientists disagree with them but they focus on the very tiny fraction of holdouts
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: as in the lottery case this focus might be enough to sustain their skepticism
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: we have seen this pattern before
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: antivaccine proponents for example aware that medical professionals disagree with their position focus on any bit of fringe research that might say otherwise
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: skeptical allure can be gripping
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: piling on more evidence does not typically shake you out of it just as making it even more probable that you will lose the lottery does not all of a sudden make you feel like you know your ticket is a loser
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: one way to counter the effects of skepticism is to stop talking about knowledge and switch to talking about probabilities
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: instead of saying that you dont know some claim try to estimate the probability that it is true
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: as hedge fund managers economists policy researchers doctors and bookmakers have long been aware the way to make decisions while managing risk is through probabilities
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: once we switch to this perspective claims to not know like those made by trump lose their force and we are pushed to think more carefully about the existing data and engage in costbenefit analyses
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: interestingly people in the grips of skepticism are often still willing to accept the objective probabilities
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: think about the lottery case again
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: although you find it hard to say you know the shopper will lose the lottery you readily agree that it is still very probable that he will lose
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: what this suggests is that even climate skeptics could budge on their estimated likelihood of climate change without renouncing their initial skepticism
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: its easy to say you dont know but its harder to commit to an actual low probability estimate in the face of overwhelming contrary evidence
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: socrates was correct that awareness of ones ignorance is virtuous but philosophers have subsequently uncovered many pitfalls associated with claims of ignorance
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: an appreciation of these issues can help elevate public discourse on important topics including the future of our planet
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: n ngel pinillos is a professor of philosophy in the school of historical philosophical and religious studies at arizona state university
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: now in print modern ethics in 77 arguments and the stone reader modern philosophy in 133 arguments with essays from the series edited by peter catapano and simon critchley published by liveright books
author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

author: N. ngel Pinillos
title: Opinion | Knowledge, Ignorance and Climate Change

sentence: for more than a century one school of political science dominated the education of turkeys governing class  until the erdogan regime set about destroying it
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: creditcredit above former members of the ankara university faculty of political science also known as mulkiye including canberk gurer ilhan uzgel elcin aktoprak and kerem altiparmak
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: photographs by emin ozmenmagnum for the new york times
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: ilhan uzgel learned he had been fired while driving his honda civic from the village of ayas to ankara after a visit to his ailing elderly father
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: a little after midnight one of his former research assistants called his cellphone
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: ilhan hocam the student said using a turkish honorific my teacher bestowed on educators
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: your name was on the list when uzgel returned to his ankara apartment his 4yearold son was sleeping but his wife elcin aktoprak was up waiting
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: she hadnt wanted to call him herself with the news while he was driving
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: now she comforted her husband  and then uzgel comforted her because aktoprak also a professor told him that she had lost her job too
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: they had been professors at ankara university on the faculty of its storied school of political science widely known as mulkiye
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: uzgel attended a provincial university in his home city bursa before enrolling in mulkiye to get a masters degree and eventually his doctorate  an accomplishment for someone of his modest origins
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: in turkey to be a part of mulkiye was to have a special status to be both of the country and in a way superior to it
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: the joke went that for mulkiyeliler or mulkiye alumni it was first mulkiye then turkiye uzgel one of turkeys leading specialists in americanturkish relations and the author or editor of books with grand titles like national interest and foreign policy proudly remained at mulkiye for 30 years until feb 7 2017 when he was fired
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: some 6000 of turkeys 150000 academics would ultimately share his fate
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: many turkish academics grew up hoping that they would one day see their country become a democracy
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: they studied sociology or philosophy they specialized in conflict resolution peace building minority rights things like the creation of civil society
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: they received their phds in political science or history expressly to participate in liberalminded universities that would bring forth generations even more democratic than themselves
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: they had faith in things like good governance practices a fair judicial system a free press human rights and womens rights
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: there was a goal and an understanding that you were either part of democratization or you werent
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: in turkey those who engaged in the creation of a democracy as a painful stepbystep process constituted a small passionate group but they shared this experience with people all across the world from poland to taiwan with those who also lived in democratizing countries who felt that their countries were on the upswing getting better whatever that meant
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: an authoritarian state can do many things to get rid of these democratic types  put them in jail put them on trial  but ultimately the government must attack the institutions that produce and sustain them
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: newspapers can be easy to buy
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: ngos are easy to shut down
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: universities are much harder to dismantle
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: but this is what through the great purge president recep tayyip erdogan and his allies sought to do
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: thousands of academics lost their jobs and many lost their right to travel their passports canceled
author: Suzy Hansen
title: The Era of People Like You Is Over: How Turkey Purged Its Intellectuals

sentence: state of the art i first got news of the school shooting in parkland fla via an alert on my watch
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: even though i had turned off news notifications months ago the biggest news still somehow finds a way to slip through
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: but for much of the next 24 hours after that alert i heard almost nothing about the shooting
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: there was a lot i was glad to miss
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: for instance i didnt see the false claims  possibly amplified by propaganda bots  that the killer was a leftist an anarchist a member of isis and perhaps just one of multiple shooters
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: i missed the fox news report tying him to syrian resistance groups even before his name had been released
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: i also didnt see the claim circulated by many news outlets including the new york times as well as by senator bernie sanders and other liberals on twitter that the massacre had been the 18th school shooting of the year which wasnt true
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: instead the day after the shooting a friendly person ive never met dropped off three newspapers at my front door
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: that morning i spent maybe 40 minutes poring over the horror of the shooting and a million other things the newspapers had to tell me
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: not only had i spent less time with the story than if i had followed along as it unfolded online i was better informed too
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: because i had avoided the innocent mistakes  and the more malicious misdirection  that had pervaded the first hours after the shooting my first experience of the news was an accurate account of the actual events of the day
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: this has been my life for nearly two months
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: in january after the breakingnewsiest year in recent memory i decided to travel back in time
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: i turned off my digital news notifications unplugged from twitter and other social networks and subscribed to home delivery of three print newspapers  the times the wall street journal and my local paper the san francisco chronicle  plus a weekly newsmagazine the economist
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: i have spent most days since then getting the news mainly from print though my selfimposed asceticism allowed for podcasts email newsletters and longform nonfiction books and magazine articles
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: basically i was trying to slowjam the news  i still wanted to be informed but was looking to formats that prized depth and accuracy over speed
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: it has been life changing
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: turning off the buzzing breakingnews machine i carry in my pocket was like unshackling myself from a monster who had me on speed dial always ready to break into my day with halfbaked bulletins
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: now i am not just less anxious and less addicted to the news i am more widely informed though there are some blind spots
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: and im embarrassed about how much free time i have  in two months i managed to read half a dozen books took up pottery and i think became a more attentive husband and father
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: most of all i realized my personal role as a consumer of news in our broken digital news environment
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: we have spent much of the past few years discovering that the digitization of news is ruining how we collectively process information
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: technology allows us to burrow into echo chambers exacerbating misinformation and polarization and softening up society for propaganda
author: Farhad Manjoo
title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: with artificial intelligence making audio and video as easy to fake as text were entering a hallofmirrors dystopia what some are calling an information apocalypse and were all looking to the government and to facebook for a fix

title: For Two Months, I Got My News From Print Newspapers. Heres What I Learned.

sentence: but dont you and i also have a part to play

sentence: education secretary betsy devos on friday officially repealed an obamaera regulation that sought to crack down on forprofit colleges and universities that produced graduates with no meaningful job prospects and mountains of student debt they could not hope to repay

title: DeVos Repeals Obama-Era Rule Cracking Down on For-Profit Colleges

sentence: cnnthe united states is withdrawing assistance from northwest syria as the trump administration reviews hundreds of millions of dollars in stabilization aid to syria a state department official has told cnn
author: By Jamie Crawford
title: US withdrawing aid from northwest Syria

sentence: the withdrawal of assistance comes as the usled military coalition battles the remaining elements of isis in the middle euphrates river valley along the syrian border of iraq
author: By Jamie Crawford
title: US withdrawing aid from northwest Syria

author: By Jamie Crawford
title: US withdrawing aid from northwest Syria

sentence: distinct from that amount us assistance for programs in northwest syria are being freed up to provide potential increased support for priorities in northeast syria as will be determined by the outcome of the ongoing assistance review including the disis campaign and stabilization efforts
author: By Jamie Crawford
title: US withdrawing aid from northwest Syria

sentence: while the usled coalition has cleared the countrys northwestern region of isis al qaedalinked groups such as the nusra front still maintain a foothold there and syrian president bashar alassads government has been consolidating gains in territory there that it had lost to rebel forces raising questions about what the us withdrawal of aid will mean for syrias future
author: By Jamie Crawford
title: US withdrawing aid from northwest Syria

sentence: president donald trump has repeatedly said it is time for arab allies in the region to take responsibility for syria in order to allow the united states to focus on priorities on the home front

sentence: but there is concern that a withdrawal of us development and reconstruction aid could curtail american influence to reach an outcome in line with longerterm us interests

title: US withdrawing aid from northwest Syria

author: By Jamie Crawford

sentence: the lack of us involvement in northwest syria could also give terrorist groups like the nusra front a base from which to mount terror operations and exploit the volatile political situation to their benefit leighton said
author: By Jamie Crawford

title: US withdrawing aid from northwest Syria

author: By Jamie Crawford

sentence: cnnthe us department of justice has launched an investigation into the sales and marketing of a drug approved three years ago to help treat parkinsons patients suffering from debilitating psychosis
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: the drugs maker acadia pharmaceuticals disclosed the investigation in filings with the securities and exchange commission
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: citing a desperate need for a seriously ill population the food and drug administration approved nuplazid in 2016 despite a conclusion from the governments medical reviewer that the benefits of the antipsychotic medication didnt outweigh its risks
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: it is the only drug on the market approved to combat hallucinations and delusions in parkinsons patients
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: in november sec filings acadia said it had received a civil investigative demand or cid requesting certain documents and information under the false claims act which the federal government uses to recoup fraudulent gains
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: the company said it had received the cid in september
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: it did not provide details to cnn or in its filings about what prompted the investigation
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: acadia said it is fully cooperating with the governments request and that it will continue to do so
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: acadia is committed to a culture of compliance and we foster business practices grounded in responsible and ethical behavior intended to fully comply with applicable laws and regulations the company said in a statement to cnn
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: it also said that nothing is more important to the company than the wellbeing of the people who use nuplazid
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: the doj did not comment
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: the origins and focus of this specific investigation have not been made public and false claims act experts interviewed by cnn said doj inquiries like this do not necessarily mean the government already has strong evidence of wrongdoing and can often take years to be resolved
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: health care fraud attorneys and professors say the majority of false claims investigations start with lawsuits filed by whistleblowers alleging wrongdoing in the hopes the government will join the case and take action against the company or individuals
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: if successful these cases can result in payouts for the whistleblowers and are kept under seal until the government has time to investigate the allegations and decide whether to intervene
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: the false claims act can be used in health care fraud cases including those involving either allegations of kickbacks to doctors or offlabel marketing according to the federal government
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: it is illegal for pharmaceutical salespeople to tout a medication for unapproved uses
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: and while pharmaceutical companies are allowed to pay a doctor to promote a drug to colleagues and other medical professionals doctors cannot prescribe the drug in exchange for payments from a manufacturer  known as kickbacks
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: some of these investigations end with no government action while others have led to multimilliondollar settlements and penalties
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: cids are unfortunately common  but in the same way that health care fraud is unfortunately common
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: they signal that doj is aware of credible allegations of fraud said jim barger an attorney who specializes in false claims act litigation and a professor at the university of alabama school of law
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: companies and investors should take cids very seriously and proceed with caution
author: Blake Ellis
title: New Parkinson's psychosis drug target of DOJ probe

sentence: they are not to be shrugged off as some routine inquiry

title: Britain's HSBC to help modern slaves 'rebuild lives' with bank access

sentence: banks usually require proof of address and identity documents like passports to open accounts which can exclude victims of slavery and trafficking who may have had these documents confiscated or live in safe houses
author: Sarah  Shearman, Thomson Reuters Foundation
title: Britain's HSBC to help modern slaves 'rebuild lives' with bank access

sentence: financial independence is a vital part of this rebuilding process victoria atkins britains minister for crime safeguarding and vulnerability said in a statement
author: Sarah  Shearman, Thomson Reuters Foundation

title: Britain's HSBC to help modern slaves 'rebuild lives' with bank access

title: Britain's HSBC to help modern slaves 'rebuild lives' with bank access

title: Britain's HSBC to help modern slaves 'rebuild lives' with bank access
